page.title: 11Chilton's Interesting Houses
page.content: {Cross House}was built in 1870, and became a Church School in the early 20th. century.It was closed in 1950 when Chilton County Primary School was built, and converted for private use. {The Goddards}is a brick and timber framed farmhouse on Church Hill.It is said to have a ghost.It was known as The School House when the village headmistress lived there many years ago The south-west wing of{Place Farm}, formerly known as{Lattons Place},has been dated to the 15th. century. It is a large timber-framed farmhouse with 15 rooms, a servants' staircase to the attic rooms,and rumours of a child ghost. {The Old Rectory},now divided into 3 very individual dwellings,shows by its size the social importance given to the village rector. :::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
